source_sentence: 佛說須達經
translation: Foshuo suoda jing

source_sentence: 蕭齊中印度三藏求那毗地譯
translation: Xiao Qi Translation of the Tripiṭaka of Central India, Qunavidi

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，婆伽婆在舍衛城祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I heard: One time, the Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 彼時，須達居士至世尊所，到已禮世尊足，却坐一面。
translation: That monk Sudarśana went to the Bhagavān, paid homage to his feet when he arrived, and withdrew to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 須達居士却坐一面已，世尊告曰：「頗有，居士！
translation: After he withdrew to sit at one side, the Bhagavān addressed him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 在家施與不？」
translation: Do you give alms at home?"

source_sentence: 「唯世尊！
translation: "Only the Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 在家有施與者，所有施不能妙食，有雜穬麻子為羹，薑一枚以為施。」
translation: At home, there are people who give alms, and those who give unsatisfactory food have mixed Mario sesame seeds to make soup and one piece of ginger to give as an offering."

source_sentence: 「此，居士！
translation: "Thus, householder!

source_sentence: 非妙施。
translation: "It's not wonderful giving.

source_sentence: 有妙施者，二俱有報。
translation: When there's wonderful giving, both have rewards.

source_sentence: 此居士！
translation: This householder!

source_sentence: 為非妙施者，彼不信施，亦不時施，不自手施，亦不就往而施，不知、不有信，亦不知有報而行施。
translation: "For someone who doesn't give wonderful gifts, they don't believe in giving, don't give from time to time, don't give from their own hand, don't give right away, don't know or have faith, and don't know there's a reward for giving.

source_sentence: 當知有如是報，意亦不在妙有屋舍，意亦不在諸妙物，意亦不在衣被，亦不在妙食，意亦不在妙五樂婬。
translation: You should know that when there's such a reward, their intention isn't for a wonderful house, nor is their intention for wonderful things, nor for clothing, nor for wonderful food, nor for the five wonderful pleasures and lust.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此居士！
translation: This householder!

source_sentence: 行非施報故。
translation: It's because of the practice of non-rewarding generosity.

source_sentence: 居士！
translation: Gṛhapati!

source_sentence: 行非施者，當有信，隨時施、自手施、往而施，有知、有信，知有報因緣已而施與。
translation: Those who practice non-giving should have faith, give at any time, give from their own hand, and give in the past with knowledge and faith, and then give after knowing there are causes and conditions for rewards.

source_sentence: 當知彼有此報，意便在妙家業，報極妙諸具、極妙衣、有極妙食、意作妙五樂婬。
translation: They should know that when they have this reward, their intention will be to engage in marvelous family activities that will result in marvelous necessities, marvelous clothing, marvelous food, and the intention to engage in the five marvelous pleasures of sexual intercourse.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此居士！
translation: This householder!

source_sentence: 當知彼有施。
translation: "You should know that they are giving.

source_sentence: 此居士！
translation: This householder!

source_sentence: 行妙施，不信施與，不隨時與，不自以手施與，不往而施，亦不知亦不信，亦不知有因緣行果報，而行施與。
translation: "Someone who gives wonderful alms doesn't believe in giving, doesn't give at any time, doesn't give with their own hands, doesn't go to give, doesn't know or believe in it, and doesn't know the rewards of actions that have causes and conditions when they give.

source_sentence: 當知彼受如是報，意亦不在妙家業，意亦不在好衣，意亦不在好食，意亦不在妙五樂婬。
translation: You should know that when they receive such a reward, their intention isn't for good family activities, good clothing, good food, or the five wonderful pleasures and lust.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 居士！
translation: Guru!

source_sentence: 此非施故。
translation: "This is not charity.

source_sentence: 此居士！
translation: This householder!

source_sentence: 妙好施者，信樂施，隨時施，自手施，往而施與，有知有信，知有行果報而行施與。
translation: "Wonderful and good givers are those who faithfully and joyfully give, give at any time, give from their own hand, and give in the past with knowledge and faith, knowing the rewards of their actions and then giving.

source_sentence: 當知彼如是得報，意在妙家業，至妙五樂婬、意在食。
translation: You should know that their reward in this way is thought to lie in good family karma, up to the five good pleasures of lust and thought in food.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此居士！
translation: This householder!

source_sentence: 當如是隨時施報。
translation: They should thus give rewards at any time.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此居士！
translation: This householder!

source_sentence: 昔有過去世，有鞞藍大婆羅門，大富極富，多錢財多諸雜物，彼如是作大施，以八十四千金鉢碎銀滿中；彼如是行大施，以八十四千銀鉢滿中碎金；彼如是行大施，彼以八十四千象，諸具嚴飾象白如雪；彼如是行大施，以八十四千馬，諸具嚴飾金為珓珞；如是行大施，以八十四千牛以衣繫之，[(殼-一)/牛]之常滿器；彼如是行大施，以八十四千玉女端正姝妙，一切諸珓珞極嚴飾之；如是行大施，餘不可數餘食諸味。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a great Brahmin from Vairambha who was extremely wealthy and had a lot of money and property and a lot of sundry things, and he thus made a great gift by filling 84,000 gold bowls with broken silver; he thus made a great gift by filling 84,000 silver bowls with broken gold; he thus made a great gift by decorating 84,000 elephants with ornaments as white as snow; he thus made a great gift by decorating 84,000 horses with ornaments as gold jewelry; he thus made a great gift by tying 84,000 cattle to his robe and [shell - 1)/cattle] always filling his vessel; he thus made a great gift by decorating 84,000 jade maidens with ornaments as beautiful and handsome as all the jewelry; and he thus made a great gift of food and flavors that could not be counted among the others.

source_sentence: 謂彼居士鞞藍大富婆羅門作如是大施，施與閻浮提凡夫人，寧施與彼一仙人，得福多。
translation: That Cūḷapanthaka Vairocana great wealthy brāhmaṇa made such a great gift, giving it to a worldling from Jambudvīpa rather than to one of those sages, which reaps much merit.

source_sentence: 雖居士鞞藍大富婆羅門作如是大施，施與閻浮提仙人者，不如施與一須陀洹，此得福多。
translation: Even though that Cūḍapanthaka Vairocana great wealthy brāhmaṇa makes such a great gift and gives it to an immortal from Jambudvīpa, it's not as meritorious as giving it to a single stream-winner.

source_sentence: 雖彼居士鞞藍大富婆羅門，施與閻浮提凡夫人及仙人、百須陀洹，不如施與一斯陀含，此得福多。
translation: Even though that Cūḍapanthaka Vairocana great wealthy brāhmaṇa gives to a mortal woman or an immortal or a hundred streamers in Jambudvīpa, it's not as good as giving to a single streamer, which obtains much merit.

source_sentence: 雖居士鞞藍大富婆羅門，作如是施與閻浮提凡夫人、仙人、百須陀洹、百斯陀含，不如施與一阿那含，此得福多。
translation: Even though that Cunda Vairocana great wealthy brāhmaṇa did this kind of giving to ordinary ladies, sages, a hundred streamers, and a hundred once-returners in Jambudvīpa, it wouldn't be as good as giving to a single nonreturner, which would be very meritorious.

source_sentence: 雖居士鞞藍大富婆羅門，作如是施與閻浮提凡夫人至百阿那含，不如施與一阿羅漢，得福多。
translation: Even though the Cūḍapanthaka Vairocana great wealthy brāhmaṇa thus makes a gift to a worldling from Jambudvīpa to a hundred nonreturners, it wouldn't be as meritorious as giving it to an arhat.

source_sentence: 謂居士！
translation: That's what I mean, householder!

source_sentence: 雖鞞藍大富婆羅門，作如是施與閻浮提凡夫人至百阿羅漢，不如施一辟支佛，得福多。
translation: Even though Vairocana is a great wealthy brāhmaṇa, such a gift to a worldling from Jambudvīpa up to a hundred arhats wouldn't be as meritorious as giving to a single pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 謂居士！
translation: That's what I mean, householder!

source_sentence: 雖鞞藍大富婆羅門作如是施，施與閻浮提凡夫人至百辟支佛，不如施與如來、無所著、等正覺，此得福多。
translation: Even though Vairocana the great wealthy brāhmaṇa makes such a gift to a worldling from Jambudvīpa to the hundred pratyekabuddhas, it's not as good as giving it to the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One, which obtains much merit.

source_sentence: 謂居士鞞藍大富婆羅門作如是施，施與閻浮提凡夫人至百辟支佛，作房舍以施與招提僧者，得福多。
translation: Suppose a layman of Vairocana and a wealthy brāhmaṇa makes this kind of gift to an ordinary woman from Jambudvīpa up to the hundred pratyekabuddhas, and then he builds a dwelling to give to a solicitation monk, this obtains much merit.

source_sentence: 謂居士鞞藍大富婆羅門作如是施，施與閻浮提凡夫人，至作房舍已施與招提僧，不如以清淨意作三自歸佛法及比丘僧、受其戒，此得福多。
translation: Suppose a layman from Vairocana and the great wealthy brāhmaṇa makes such a gift to a woman from Jambudvīpa up to 100 pratyekabuddhas, and then he builds a dwelling and gives it to a soliciting monk, rather than making three self-returners to the Buddha, the monks, and the acceptance of their precepts with a pure mind, this will be very meritorious.

source_sentence: 謂居士鞞藍大富婆羅門作如是大施，施與閻浮提凡夫人至以清淨行三自歸佛法及比丘僧、受其戒，不如於一切眾生行於慈至[(殼-一)/牛]牛頃，此得福多。
translation: It would be much more meritorious if a layman named Vairocana the Great Wealthy Brāhmaṇa made such a great gift and gave it to a common woman in Jambudvī until she had done the three self-returners to the Buddha's teaching, the monks and bhikṣus, and accepted their precepts with a pure intention than to practice kindness toward all sentient beings up to [(hull - 1)/cow] an instant.

source_sentence: 謂居士鞞藍大富婆羅門作如是施與閻浮提凡夫人，至謂於一切眾生分別行慈，下至[(殼-一)/牛]牛頃；謂一切行無常、苦、空、無我，思惟念者，下至彈指頃，此得福多。
translation: It would be much more meritorious if a layman of Vairocana and a wealthy brāhmaṇa did thus bestow gifts on ordinary ladies of Jambudvīpa, or if he were to practice kindness to all sentient beings separately down to [hull-monkey/niew] an instant, or if he were to contemplate and think about the impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness of all conditioned things down to the snap of a finger.

source_sentence: 汝居士！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 作如是念：『彼居士鞞藍大富婆羅門異耶？』
translation: He had this thought, 'Does that householder Vairocana Mahaprabhāsa differ from the Brahmans?'

source_sentence: 莫作是念，我即是彼名鞞藍大富婆羅門！
translation: Don't think, 'I am that great wealthy brāhmaṇa called Vera!'

source_sentence: 如是，居士！
translation: So it is, householder!

source_sentence: 自住於饒益及饒益他、饒益多人，愍於世間，以義以樂安隱天及人，如是為說法，未至竟盡，未至竟無垢，未至竟梵行，未至竟行梵行，彼故未脫生老病死憂慼不樂，我說未脫苦。
translation: He abides by himself to benefit others and many people, pities the world, secures gods and humans with meaning and pleasure, and thus teaches the Dharma before it reaches its full completion, before it reaches its full unsulliedness, before it reaches its full religious practice, and before it reaches its full religious practice, so he's not freed from the grief and unhappiness of birth, age, sickness, death, and I say he's not freed from suffering.

source_sentence: 此居士！
translation: This monk!

source_sentence: 今如來出世間，無所著、等正覺、明行成為、善逝、世間解、無上士、道法御、天人師、佛、世尊，今自為故、為他故、為多人故、愍世間故，以義以樂安隱天及人。
translation: Now, the Tathāgata appears in the world as unattached, perfectly enlightened, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, well gone, worldly-understood, unsurpassed, a trainer on the path and teachings, a teacher to gods and humans, a Buddha, and a Bhagavān, and now he does it for his own sake, for the sake of others, for the sake of many people, and for the sake of pity for the world, so that he can make gods and humans comfortable with meaning.

source_sentence: 我今為說法，至竟盡、至竟無垢、至竟梵行、至竟行梵行，今以得脫生老病死憂慼不樂苦，我說已離苦。」
translation: Now, I explain the teaching for you, saying, 'Until it's ended, until it's spotless, until the end of the religious practice, until the end of the religious practice, until the end of the religious practice, now I've freed myself from the suffering of birth, old age, illness, death, grief, and unhappiness, and I've explained it.'"

source_sentence: 佛如是說。
translation: Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 居士須達聞世尊所說，歡喜而樂。
translation: Hearing what the Bhagavān taught, Cūḷa Sudatta rejoiced and was delighted.

source_sentence: 佛說須達經
translation: The Buddha taught the Sudatta Sutra.
